snippet: National Park Service rangers are now able to take the public inside Castle Williams, a red sandstone fortress at the western tip of Governors Island, for the first time in its 200-year history.
abstract: National Park Service rangers are now able to take the public inside Castle Williams, a red sandstone fortress at the western tip of Governors Island, for the first time in its 200-year history.
lead_paragraph: National Park Service rangers are now able to take the public inside Castle Williams, a red sandstone fortress at the western tip of Governors Island, for the first time in its 200-year history.

headline.seo: Touring Castle Williams on Governors Island
headline.main: From Here You Could Shoot in Every Direction
